title: Church of Our Most Holy Redeemer and St Thomas More, Chelsea
text:
The Church of Our Most Holy Redeemer and St Thomas More, also referred to as Holy Redeemer Church, is a <a href="Roman%20Catholic">Roman Catholic</a> <a href="Parish%20church">Parish church</a> in <a href="Chelsea%2C%20London">Chelsea, London</a>. it was built in the 19th century and opened on 23 October 1895. It was designed by <a href="Edward%20Goldie">Edward Goldie</a>. It is situated on the corner of Upper Cheyne Row and <a href="Cheyne%20Row">Cheyne Row</a>, next to <a href="Carlyle%27s%20House">Carlyle's House</a> in the <a href="Royal%20Borough%20of%20Kensington%20and%20Chelsea">Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea</a>. It is <a href="Listed%20building%23England%20and%20Wales">listed Grade II</a> on the <a href="National%20Heritage%20List%20for%20England">National Heritage List for England</a>.
History.
Construction.
In the early 1890s, <a href="Cardinal%20%28Catholicism%29">Cardinal</a> <a href="Herbert%20Vaughan">Herbert Vaughan</a> requested Canon Cornelius James Keens to go to Chelsea and create a <a href="Mission%20%28Christianity%29">mission</a> to serve the local Catholic population. In 1892 Canon Keens obtained permission from the <a href="Archdiocese%20of%20Westminster">Archdiocese of Westminster</a> to build a church in the area. Originally, it was to be called the Church of the Most Holy Redeemer. The foundation stone was laid on 7 June 1894 and the church was opened on 23 October 1895. The church was consecrated on 21 June 1905 by <a href="Francis%20Bourne">Cardinal Francis Bourne</a>.
Renamed.
The dedication of the church was changed in 1935 after <a href="Thomas%20More">Thomas More</a> was <a href="canonised">canonised</a>. It became the Church of the Most Holy Redeemer and St Thomas More.
Repair and renovation.
In September 1940, during the <a href="Second%20World%20War">Second World War</a>, the church was damaged by a bomb which killed nineteen people. The west wall and organ were destroyed. After the war, the church was repaired.
In 1962, the restoration work was undertaken in the church. From 1970 to 1972, the church was reordered. The floor of the <a href="chancel">chancel</a> was relaid, so that the altar could be brought towards the congregation and a marble <a href="Pulpit">ambo</a> was installed. In 1980 a new font was also installed to match the ambo.
Parish.
The church has five Sunday <a href="Mass%20%28Catholic%20Church%29">Masses</a>, at 6:30pm on Saturday, 10:00am and 11:00am on Sunday and 12:15pm and 6:30pm on Sunday. It also has weekday Masses at 8:00am from Monday to Friday.
